reviewText: The levels are amusing to play through, but they won’t resonate with people who are used to stellar platforming titles like Rayman Legends, ‘Splosion Man, Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze, and Kirby’s Epic Yarn. Of course, you’re paying a fraction of the price here, but it’s important to know that the amount of enjoyment you’ll derive from it will take a hit as well.The game is an entry-level platformer that will appeal more to younger children with its simple design and, with the exception of some challenging final levels, it's quite easy. I would quickly and wholeheartedly recommend this game anyone from 5 to 55. But for others looking for something a little deeper and more challenging, you may want to continue searching.

reviewText:
Played this game previously on the Nintendo Wii U and I can say on PC it fixes on everything wrong with that version.

Problem #1. Loading Screens - on PC the game starts up in a mere 3- 4 seconds. Wii U it takes almost 15 seconds.. even being at 720p while 1080p on PC.

Problem #2. Better Controller on PC - The Xbox 360 Controller is a little tighter than the Wii U Gamepad does in some parts But if you use the Pro Controller while playing it feels better.

Problem #3. Glitches on Wii U - Certain very weird glitches on the Wii U version happened to me alot. One of them was when touching a certain part of the sky leaves would be falling. Leaves only fall from a tree in the game but there was no tree insight or close enough. PC Has no such problems when you go through a tree leaves fall and looks good.

Problem #4. Cheaper on PC than Wii U - PC version only costs (as of 10-26-2014) $6.79 while on Wii U it charges you another $1.00 for tax while still being $7.99 so over $9.00 for the game. Nintendo please stop charging for TAX on a game Steam Sony and Microsoft do not charge TAX on anything on there stores please stop charging for TAX.

Otherwise fun game very easy but anyone can play it and think of Little Big Planet and Paper Mario mashed together.

8/10

I wish devs will look into it.

reviewText:
“Do not reinvent the wheel” is something that the creators of Papers Monsters Recut has taken to heart. The game is essentially a combination of Super Mario platforming gimmicks with the art style and music of LittleBigPlanet with the storyline of Sonic.

Incidentally from Mario:     in each stage, there are three big collectables you can get
there is an overworld that links the stages
100 buttons makes a life
grassland, water land, ice land, lava land, etc.
you stomp on enemies to remove them
… and MORE!

The near non-existant storyline is that Dr. Robotnik Bowser? is turning innocent wildlife into monsters and Sonic the nameless box protagonist is going to stop him.

Furthermore the game has a lot of bugs which makes it very frustrating to play. In the short time I’ve played this game, I’ve encountered numerous bugs which demonstrates a lack of testing. The most popular being the sudden absence of the health bar which renders your character immune to death. Several times, the protagonist will be able to pass through pipes (the warp area) and end up in the void. I’ve also encountered a bug where the stage wouldn’t end because the game wouldn’t recognize that I was in the end area.

So really the only cutting that the creators of Papers Monsters Recut have done were the corners of ingenuity, originality, and game design.

reviewText: Paper Monster Recut recut harkens back to a simpler time. That time was when every game wanted to be the next Super Mario. The is not inherently a bad thing. There's monsters to jump on coins errr....buttons and paper clips to collect.  A very nostalgic blend of running, jumping and discovering hidden areas. The contolrs are tight and sometimes require precision jumps but hey it's a platformer, right? The look is a blend of Sonic's Green Hill Zone, Super Mario level 1-1 and Little Big Planet.  It's simple, it's charming and it's like your favorite pair of jeans. Sure they have some holes and the legs are fraying at the cuffs but they fit and they still lookl preety cool. Paper Monsters Recut is pure, simple fun.

reviewText: A nice casual platformer. The only controls for most of the game are run and jump so it's super simple but the varying environments, tight controls (I used a controller so I have no idea how good it is with a keyboard), and pleasant soundtrack kept me playing. It won't blow you away, but it's still quite good and very kid friendly.
